name: Vanilla Outside Us Nothing
description: The default playbook of Outside Us Nothing

value.name: Terre
value.description: The terre are all people descended from humanity, and long lost Earth. But after their long, long time traveling through the dark to this part of the universe, in vast generation ships, some have changed.

flavorText.text: Earth? No, never heard of it. Is that corpo propaganda? That we all came from one world before slow generation ships? Prelapsarian BS.
flavorText.attribution: Interview with a psychogogic manipulation addict in corp space

options.text: Spaceborne, adapted for null-G, fragile yet nimble on the float
Genehacked, altered cosmetically, for a new atmosphere, or anything
Cybernetically modified, an added limb, galvanic nerves, anything
Raised among exoterre (aliens) of your choice, adapting to their culture
Vampiric, lycanthropic or afflicted by other magical alterations

questions.question: Choose one you are and describe the way it has changed your life

actions.description: Make an incorrect assumption about something technical
Accidentally minorly insult an exoterre
Lack some common knowledge about the wider universe
Be unable to to do something because of whatever you picked on the right
Think about the ancient people of Earth and what they might have thought about what is happening to you
Do something else related to long ago lost Earth or the uniquely human
Get another terre to work with you, play along
Make an effort to bond with an exoterre
Use whatever you picked above to physically solve a problem
Use some knowledge of Earth to solve a problem

value.name: Z-Machine
value.description: Unlike your non-sophont cousins, the common a-machines, with z-machines the sophonts of the universe, mostly terre, have made thinking programs, computers, machines, intelligence and artificial life in all its many forms.

flavorText.text: We're built by bionts, but we're planning for the next universe.
flavorText.attribution: Motto of various z-machine longtermist factions

questions.question: Choose two things that physically describe you
Choose two you can do
Choose one you can't

actions.description: Suffer a mechanical failure
Have trouble interacting socially with a biont
Do something that frightens a biont

Closely observe or study a biont and realize something that helps you
Communicate directly, easily with another z-machine to your advantage
Use your physical construction to endure a danger or solve a problem
Repair yourself without using supplies
Use one of the two things you can do to solve a problem

value.name: Angel
value.description: Something from outside wrote you into this universe's skin alone, without instruction. As a being of pure energy you are indestructible. But to interact with everything else, to have an identity, most angels, including you, have commissioned carved bodies for themselves. Fragile and fallible bodies that now shelter and identify you.

flavorText.text: Lo brethren! We are cast out in this universe of dark! Rise up! Rise together for the glory of all angelkind! Be the light to pierce creation!

questions.question: Choose two qualities of your physical body

options.text: It cannot do some physical actions
It's cracked, warped or marked by time
It's not perfectly beautiful like you were
You have altered it, but your body resists change

questions.question: Choose three limits imposed on you by physical your body

actions.description: Be limited by your body
Have your body hurt or break
Mourn for when you were immortal energy
Do something else as a being written into the universe
Momentarily have your energy leave your body to solve a problem
Move impossibly quick, be impossibly strong, defy the laws of physics, or otherwise break limits
If possible, modify your body

value.name: Devil
value.description: You're a piece of a different universe. Once you were all a part of it. Then, pushed into this reality, came division, change, individuality. Your body does not obey the laws of physics. No one can describe your real, shifting form, but you control what you people perceive when they look at you.

flavorText.text: The fabula was shifting but eternal. I like the change in this universe better, tbh. You can be a new thing here. Make something of yourself.
flavorText.attribution: PR statement of a devil mob boss known for selling spiked godspit

options.text: Something human or some other alien
Something buzzing and insectile or slimy, slick

questions.question: Choose three things people see looking at you
Choose one thing you make sure they don't

actions.description: Shift your body around
Shift your identity around
Struggle with maintaining a single identity, or knowing your true self, whatever that is
Do something else about emerging from a shifting, hellish gestalt
Scare someone with what they see in you
Reveal something true about your real self to solve a problem
Lie about your real self to solve a problem

value.name: Bawalang
value.description: Bawalangasi are one of the most successful and widespread aliens in the universe. Highly adaptable because of their indotribes or pledge-family's ability to choose new morphs and castes to be born, there are an almost limitless number of forms an insectile bawalang can take, depending on the needs and circumstances surrounding their birth. Your birth.

flavorText.text: When terre see me it's either freaks into me or running away screaming about bugs. I'm just a lady struggling against the caste I was born to, man.
flavorText.attribution: Bawalangasi exile from her indotribe, talking of life on a terre ship

options.text: Regrown limbs and chitin plates recovering

questions.question: Choose two ways you describe your current chosen form
Choose one way your indotribe would describe your birth-form

actions.description: Lose a limb, to regrow sometime later, leaving you less mobile
Lose some carapace, exoskeleton, leaving you vulnerable
Be limited by birth form or current form
Do something else with your clicking, chitinous of hard angles
Have all the perspectives, literally with compound eyes or else figuratively
Use your birth form or current form to solve a problem
Regrow a limb, scar over an injury or the past

value.name: Harrisi
value.description: Harrisi are not related to birds of prey or raptorial dinosaurs from Earth, but some terre may be forgiven for thinking that. With feathers of many shades and colors, a hooked beak, scaled and clawed hands, and a wide, tail of feathers, harrisi are common across the universe, almost always found in large packs. Far, far less common, however, is one like you, alone among the Freetravelers.

flavorText.text: Sing the void. Sing your place within the void. Sing the pack, and your place within the pack within the void.
flavorText.attribution: Traditional cavern tune relating to being adopted into a pack

options.text: Deep, striking eyes of a color of your choice
It is bigger or smaller than most harrisi

questions.question: Choose two qualities of your body
Choose why you don't have your pack
Gender

actions.description: Be unable to do something because you don't have a pack
Fail to do something you used to do with your pack
Do something small your pack loved
Do something else related to your avian pack predator nature, now without a pack
You are a fast moving, agile predator, use it
Do something your pack wouldn't allow you do to
Do something you used to do with your pack by yourself
Make a new pack

value.name: Zph
value.description: You aren't one thing, one body, you are many. A group of tiny, bodies of many types and uses, controlled by one group intelligence. You. Your many bodies might have different purposes, designs, even origins. They might die, you might need new ones, but one thing had remained true for all those eons. You are still you.

flavorText.text: Consciousness is drifting now. Tiny parts in each body. Changing with the joinings, and dyings, and births of me. Now hive, now swarm, now spawn.

options.text: Bodies dying until who you were changed
You, other zph mingling â€˜til you were one

questions.question: Choose one you want to remember from your long life
Choose one you want to forget from your long life
Choose two to describe your many bodies

actions.description: Let some of your bodies die of illness or old age
Idly recall a distant memory
Let your bodies scurry off, mound together, shift
Do something else emerging from a long lived swarm intelligence
Use one of your many long memories to solve a problem
Sacrifice some of your bodies to solve an immediate threat, no matter that you forget something when they die
Extend your bodies further afield to spy on something new
Let roughly half your bodies wander off to make a new zph

value.name: Teuth
value.description: Teuth like you grow to fill the space available to them. Something like a plant, something like a squid, with way too many teeth, and eyes, and other organs, your many projections and sessile, tentacles and more sessile biology mostly stick to the walls and floors and out of the way hidey-holes, nooks and crannies of your ship so as not to disturb your shipmates. But while hidden in there you are still growing deeper into the ship, still talking to the others, still making decisions, still inextricably now and forever a part of the ship and part of the crew.

flavorText.text: The others always come & go, ken? Barque's old, old & I seen dozens of species, dozens of crew pass through. Na me though. I grown deep, strong roots far into everything of this here barque. You're na recording me, aye, Sri?
flavorText.attribution: Recorded during interview with a teuth Freetraveler docked at Orbital Descant

Feel far bigger than everyone else, far grosser

Take control of, fix, or change something on the ship
Protect your ship and your loved ones on it no matter the cost
Leave the ship, enter a new one

value.name: The Corpo Citoyen
value.description: You used to be someone rich enough to afford citizenship from one of the big interstellar corporations. Life was different. You had healthcare. Knew where the next meal was coming from. Were always watched and controlled.

flavorText.text: Relativation 189 DiemBucks per period, air 177 DiemBucks, food 480, water 230, medical 1060, heat 108, light 98. They have a station tax too.
flavorText.attribution: Resident quoting DiemCo policy for life on station Calypso Transcend

questions.question: Choose one you still carry from the corp
Choose one your corp asked you to be you will never be again

actions.description: Brag insensitively about how you used to live
Struggle to handle being poor
Make a mistake about how much something costs
Think about how far you have fallen
Do something related to your former employment
Play on insecurities, play people against each other
Realize a hidden or concealed power dynamic

value.name: The Indenture
value.description: Debt, hunger, or desperation. For some reason you signed your freedom to a corporation, agreeing to hard labor in exchange for some theoretical future payment. You realized there was no way out of the contract. So you ran.

flavorText.text: â€œDiemCo threatened to space me from Transcend Calypso for not paying the relativation fee. Relativation, artificial gravity, that was dangerously cheap.
flavorText.attribution: Indenture in a orichalcum mine, explaining why he signed his contract

questions.question: Choose what the corp had you working on

value.name: The Born Wanderer
value.description: You're the rare specimen born into Freetraveling. Maybe you're young, maybe you're experienced, maybe your story started on a different ship, maybe you left and came back. But you know this life between the stars out in the black like nothing else.

flavorText.text: â€œFreetravelers? Yeah, few million of us. Scattered across megalightperiods of space at minimum. Na many. Most live it â€˜til find-su world to settle in.
flavorText.attribution: Freetraveler, an Alternative, bootleg documentary banned in most polities

options.text: Something from your parents, sibling, family
Something of the physical ship itself
Something worth a lot of money

value.name: The Veteran
value.description: The universe is not calm. Corporations vie for control of worlds, aliens clash, old prejudices and angers reappear. You used to fight in one of these many conflicts. But you did something not all can. You walked away

flavorText.text: â€œHer Angelic Highness' crusades push on the Psmanthics, push on DiemCo, pushes on the fascist Constabulary of Humanity, who fight the unions
flavorText.attribution: Syndicalist partisan on planetary Winnipeg, as quoted by Sri Marmolejo

options.text: A hatred of being ordered around
A certain way you hold your body
A way you talk, act, make your bed

value.name: The Exile
value.description: Most people can return. You can't. Because of the law, or family, or a person out to get you. Something dangerous keeps you from returning. Or maybe just a guilty conscience. You did the only thing you could. You ran. You escaped.

flavorText.text: I am from Transcend Calypso. DiemCo banned me after I released Freetraveler, an Alternative. Special operative Xis was sent to kill me. Trained killer. I escaped.
flavorText.attribution: In My Own Words, by Sri Marmolejo banned in DiemCo trading polities

questions.question: Choose what you did

options.text: Something that doesn't exist anywhere else
Something worth killing or dying for

value.name: The Runaway
value.description: You used to live on a planet. A nice little world. A nice group of people around you. A home. Then one found nearby a space port one day and went Freetraveler. No one chased you away, no one is hunting you. You left. Why?

flavorText.text: â€œWas birthwise of frontier moon. Nice little indotribe. Will na speak ill of family. Just walked-la off the farm, found the nearest spaceport & waited.
flavorText.attribution: Bawalang Freetraveler, as quoted by Freetraveler, an Alternative

questions.question: Choose one you still carry with your from your distant home
Choose how you explain why you left to yourself, change it frequently

actions.description: Get excited about something new to distract yourself from missing home

Be naive about something new to you
Find something painfully nostalgic

Send a message back home, tell them why you left

value.name: The Abductee
value.description: One day a spaceship showed up on your uncontacted, backwater world and carried you away. Maybe you were in danger. Maybe there was a misunderstanding. Maybe it was a kidnapping. It's an old story. Abduction, for whatever reason.

flavorText.text: I was contemplating The Broken God, and his ways, when the spaceship arrived. Black and glistening with void menace over me. I was afraid.
flavorText.attribution: Nnedi ban'Xi, as quoted by Freetravelers, a Subversive Folk

options.text: Your name or your family's name
A language no one else speaks

value.name: The Apprentice
value.description: You used to be a monk. Or an acolyte. A disciple. People were trying to teach you deep, arcane, magical things. Maybe you finished and became a witch or a wizard, maybe not. But whatever the answer you still carry your early days with you now.

flavorText.text: â€œThat hack job documentary took me entirely out of context. I chose to leave that cloister, and the heresiarchs that ran it. Put my name on it.
flavorText.attribution: Nnedi ban'Xi, as quoted by Sri Marmolejo, In Rebuttal

options.text: A bit of etheric vocabulary you use
A way you don't like your reflection

value.name: The Snapcaster
value.description: A snapcaster is someone who normally wouldn't have magic, etheric powers, someone who was never apprenticed. But snapcasters grew up or spent a lot of time around a black hole, a black matter wall, in the deep wild dark, or similar. You got this way, and got your powers, through accidental exposure.

flavorText.text: â€œSubject's flesh begins to increase dramatically in mass, likely towards nuclear degenerate matter. Isolation lost just after. Location unknown.
flavorText.attribution: Intercepted communique, Psmanthic Choir, RE Sinner Sun event

value.name: The Reformed
value.description: Wherever there's civilization there's crime. Wherever there's crime there's people organizing it. Let's just say it didn't go well for you. Names change, you move on with your particular skills. Hope it's for the best.

flavorText.text: â€œThe Shroud Syndicate is raiding this establishment tomorrow. Please have protection tax ready at time of raid.
flavorText.attribution: Pamphlet drop from planetary Winnipeg, after Syndicate take over

value.name: The Prophesied
value.description: A product of the chosen one industry, born to greatness, specifically bred for one thing, circumstances of creation and youth all controlled to produce an end product. Yet here you are Freetraveling. Not doing that. Why?

flavorText.text: â€œWelcome to Winnipeg! Leading the way in the chosen one industry with our patented corp oracles! If you're here, it's because we foretold it.
flavorText.attribution: Planetary Winnipeg slogan, prior to the Constabulary ousting SaintsCo

value.name: The Amnesiac
value.description: Not everyone is lucky enough to have a coherent past. Sometimes you just wake up and have to guess if you're a construct, a reanimated corpse, a victim of psychogogic manipulation, or what.

flavorText.attribution: Maybe Xis, as overheard by a crewmate and reported to Sri Marmolejo

options.text: The memory of hurting someone else
Old video of yourself as a child
A piece of tech you can't use

value.name: Space Wizard
value.description: Wizards have long studied the many magics of the etheric sea. The all black everything. Space. And you are no different. Your mind explodes with arcane knowledge and anywhere in the universe will recognize your mastery of the art!

flavorText.text: â€œWonder before the universe. Then understand it. And then, through understanding, master it.

value.name: Planetary Witch
value.description: Witchways are the ways of stories and stories normally have a place about them. So unlike wizards, gallivanting about, witches normally stay in one place. But out here in the black you must carry your stories with you.

flavorText.text: â€œGive up sweet, idyllic ideas. Witches tell stories and the story we will tell is this: DiemCo moves in, takes over.

options.text: Its fearful power is just now waking up

value.name: Pilot
value.description: Everyone on board knows your ship, of course. Perhaps they could even fly it in a pinch. Many ships without pilots make do with low level a-machine, or someone far, far less skilled. But not so long as you are here. No one could replace you. No one else would be able to fly it like you. Sail it like you. You bring it to life like no one else could, you think.

flavorText.text: â€œBarque was old, old. Antique. Ceramic. Like a teapot. Built by a species that died afore terre came to this reach. But I could see the pilot could still make it dance.
flavorText.attribution: Khwezi, birthwise of DiemCo, about a ship destroyed in the Pale Incident

value.name: Social Liaison
value.description: People think that every door will open automatically. But docking berths, port tariffs, repairs, refueling, resupplies, new contracts, these things don't just take care of themselves. Someone needs to know how to talk to people.

flavorText.text: Devils far away from the fabula learn to shift to all sorts. Shift-la to be whatever people want me to be. I open the doors & I talk. People like me.
flavorText.attribution: Devilish Freetraveler, the night after sleeping with Sri Marmolejo

value.name: Etheric Navigator
value.description: You've been everywhere, all throughout the big nothing. You've probably been a Freetraveler the longest. You know the orbits, the dark and the ports. If you've never been there before, you likely know how to get there.

flavorText.text: 911,322 kerama points transited, 899 worlds visited, 8708 stations, 232 asteroids, 98 dark matter wells, 39 space elevators, 2 gods. Been a life.
flavorText.attribution: Freetraveler of unidentified species on Orbital Descant

options.text: The myths of ether beasts and gods you tell
The stars you reckon and pray and hope by
The wrecks you salvage and repair

value.name: Metallurgic Mechanic
value.description: You aren't like a pilot, thinking that feelings make ships fly. People project onto ships, see them as all one thing. But you know that a big piece of equipment is made up of many, many smaller pieces. These are the machines that are second nature to you.

flavorText.text: Khwezi said that â€˜bout the Russell? Thing was a piece of shit & barely keep running. â€˜Course still loved it.
flavorText.attribution: Em, birthwise of Constabulary of Humanity, Freetraveler

value.name: Intrepid Explorer
value.description: Someone needs to try the boundaries. Test the theories. Push the buttons. The universe is a big place and whenever your crew finds something they don't grok there you are. Perhaps not understanding either, but trying

flavorText.text: I think we should investigate the fabula. It is kinda invading our reality. Growing into. We know devils are parts of it, but does it want anything?
flavorText.attribution: Binti Khouri, explaining why she was in a devil forest eating a world

questions.question: Choose a field of research you are an expert in
Choose one you are an apprentice in

actions.description: Ask for advice from someone more knowledgeable than you
Admit you don't know
Lose focus, talk too fast
Focus, fret, lose yourself in thought or do something else while distracted
Make someone else think you're the smartest person in the room
Befriend someone else you respect or think is smart

Wildly hypothesize about your apprentice field. be oddly right

When you have seven facts about the field you think you know about, use them to actually learn about it and become an expert, then pick a new field to apprentice in. In addition to the seven facts, this also costs

value.name: Astral Gardener
value.description: We're all systems. Emergent computer networks, emergent biospheres, ecosystems, biotech, biology, bodies. From the personal all the way to the planetary. You tend those gardens.

flavorText.text: Bodies contain ecosystems, which are contained in ships, such. Ecosystems. Which move in capitalism, kingdoms, cults, dimensions. Ecosystems.
flavorText.attribution: Rogue terraforming z-machine found floating in Deep Wild Dark

questions.question: Choose a scale of biology you operate on
Choose one stem line

actions.description: Be unable to deal with something artificial, or technological
Scare someone when you interact with and change biology
Look over your tools, syringes, knives, vials, and instruments
Admire an emergent system
Study something organic, or do something disgusting, you can write it down if you want
Solve a small problem with an organic thing
Using something on your scale of biology preemptively warn of danger from an organic thing
Using something from on scale of biology supply a need
Using a tool, take away your stem line from an organic thing
Using a tool, add your stem line to an organic thing
Using something you have previously studied, make new tools and say what they do
If you have new tools, change the scale of biology you operate on
If you have new tools, change the way you interact with biology

value.name: Muscled Tough
value.description: It's all well and good to magic, fly, science, and talk your way out of problems but let's be honest, the universe isn't always going to play nice. You're here for when it doesn't, for when people would threaten you, your ship, and the people you love.

flavorText.text: Yes, I fought on Winnipeg. Fought for SaintsCo when the Constabulary invaded, fought for the union when the Shrouds moved in, took over.
flavorText.attribution: Planetary Winnipeg slogan, prior to the Constabulary ousting SaintsCo

Choose two that always scare you

Use a thing you always keep on you for something new

value.name: Orbital Voidworker
value.description: Superstitions abound about those that brave the out. Shipbreakers, hull patchers, spacing survivors. Not wise to look so long at void, dark things there, they say. Some fear you, others think you lucky, ethertouched.

flavorText.text: Drink vacuum, never fear the gods. Albatross, albatross, albatross again.

options.text: Light and shadow bends near you
Orbits and ether are quiet near you
Sound deadens to silence near you
Some say Deep Wild Dark itself watches you
Some say dark deities lure you towards destiny

value.name: Fresh-Faced Newbie
value.description: Almost no one is born into this life. Even those that are are not born with skills. Still you are welcomed, as long as you show the promise of things to come. You are newer, or less seasoned maybe, but everything is ahead of you.

flavorText.text: Cosmetician? Is new. Grab a mop. & grab a bucket. Start cleaning floors.
flavorText.attribution: Recollection of Freetraveler, psychogogic manipulative capture

value.name: DiemCo
value.description: An old, and well-established corporation, extending from the Reachfall system out across space. Nothing escapes their predator ships and special operatives.

value.name: TianCorp
value.description: A brutal corp demanding absolute loyalty from all employees. It considers all people who live within any of the many systems it owns to be employees, be aware.

value.name: SaintsCo
value.description: An ancient, decrepit, and largely defunct corporation, but the last few assets that have not been swooped up by newer players in the game may still pose a threat.

value.name: ApotheosInc
value.description: One of the youngests corps, eager to expand across the black and write its name on the universe.

value.name: The Psmanthic Choir
value.description: For most the Choir is a fleet of silent black. No one has seen their pilots, if they even have them. But woe betide anyone who is captured by them, or hears them singing.

value.name: The Angelic Kingdoms
value.description: Several fiefdoms ruled largely by angelic sovereigns known for their xenophobia.

value.name: The Fabula
value.description: A dimension that originated devils. It is known to be alive and at least somewhat intelligent, but what its true aims are remain elusive.

value.name: The Shroud Syndicate
value.description: A union in theory, a crime family in law, and an independent polity in practice.

value.name: The Irons Gang
value.description: A petty gang of space pirates, hungry for Freetraveler tech.

value.name: The Constabulary of Humanity
value.description: A fascist, cloner cult of human traditionalists bent on finding and reclaiming the long lost terre home.

value.name: Reclaim The Stars
value.description: Alien tech. Origin unknown. Spreading machine. Reclamation. Devouring.

value.name: SINNER SUN
value.description: Wonâ€™t leave me alone? Then BURN

value.name: [error]whispers
value.description: What? Why am I on this list, Iâ€™m your friend! This is a mistake!

value.name: Machine Killing Field
value.description:
â€œWe were out in Deep Wild Dark, past the Pale, when the tech all stopped working and my memories started coming back. I rejected them.â€
	-Maybe Xis
Some of the big corporations deploy these deliberately, but out here in the black itâ€™s probably natural. Your tech is barely working if at all. Good luck!

questions.question: From where is this field coming?

consequences.name: Crew needs strong rolls or help to escape the field
Crew escapes the field, ship continues

value.text:
One must imagine, one must hope,
That you can be born anew, to see with eyes still young.
value.attribution: The Wondererâ€™s Prayer, traditional Vomyodosoi text

value.text: When arrived-su in this Reach we were wanderers. Colonists & refugees, perhaps just wonderers. The great terre explorer, Laika, yesterdays of Earth, thought we would always be. Perhaps wrong-la. The Anarchy & Constabulary seek to settle downwise. To possess & own & by owning to change. Is enough-la to see beauty & wander on to see whatever more sights the universe still holds-la. I would na return to Earth even if possiblewise. Would betray those first survivors. Wanderers and wonderers are-su stillwise.
value.attribution: Private Journal of a terre Freetraveler

value.text: We may not know their thoughts exact, but we do know that all our ancestors came to this Reach of the universe, leaving Earth, in search of freedom. It was in the continuation of this Freedom that our various corporations were founded. The growing traditionalist clone cult calling itself the Constabulary threatens this Freedom, and for this purpose we propose a joint project between our corporate bodies to fund a predator class of barque built to hunt down and destroy this Constabulary, and anyone else who seeks to limit our Freedom.
value.attribution: From a proposed contract, given to rival businesses in Anarchy space

value.text: Some of the Elect refer to the terre-dominated part of the Llys Don Reach as the Anarchy. And it is easy to view humanity as nearly coterminous with this Anarchy, and with the corporations that control it. A place without governing principles or central identity. Minds set free through psychogogic manipulation. Philosophy set free by system failures for the masses. Worlds run by whoever can put the most barques in their orbit. Freetravelers in the grey areas. Chaos. Freedom. It would be easy to reduce humanity to this. But I believe they can be so much more.
value.attribution: From a Harrisi humanology textbook

value.text: We may not know your thoughts exact, but we do know some of what you have been about. Twenty-one assassinations of senior executives. Nine long-haul shipments lost. Two worlds bombed. The framing of our company in front of the psmanthics, the aswang, and her Angelic Highness 72 Digs Unnecessarily Convoluted Tunnels. And all due to one Special Operative. Therefore we propose, in the interest of good will, and the lifting of tariffs, that this Special Operative be turned over to us and charged with Freedom Theft in the First Degree. Let us use our Special Operatives, rather, against enemies of business, such as the Constabulary, as they were intended.
value.attribution: From a proposed contract, given to rival businesses in Anarchy space

value.text: Feeling lost? Directionless? Alone in an uncaring universe? Then come on down to SaintsCo, where weâ€™ve got plenty of prophets, prophecies, and prophecied ones for you! Remember, if youâ€™re here, itâ€™s because we foretold it!
value.attribution: Ad from the SaintsCo Promotional Board, prior to Constabulary takeover

value.text: My son, my son, listen well and heed me when I say this. There are ways humans organize themselves in the absence of order. Unions. Tribes. Companies. And in all cases these are the same. Avaricious. Greedy. Short-sighted. Therefore reject them, and embrace our truth. The truth that only a central identity can give. Reject your petty wants, all wants, save those subjected to duty.
value.attribution: Letter to a Constabulary Squire, from their father

value.text: Some-su have big, complicated philosophies â€˜bout how the appellation â€˜Anarchyâ€™ came to restwise on the yonder parts of the Reach dominated by large terre-originating corps like DiemCo & TianCorp, if it be truly anarchy, ratherwise kleptocratic hierarchy disguised liberty-ward, or if-su the Freetravelers be a better manifestation of true freedom. I na care. To me all that matters is this: when someone needs help you help them. & the rest is commentary.
value.attribution: Private Journal of a teuth Freetraveler

value.text: I still feel the night. I breathe, I yearn, I die. I hope to see it once again, and the beauty dreadfully distinct against the dark.
value.attribution: The Void and Stellar Parallax Song, traditional harrisi cavern-tune

value.text: Devils, on the other hand, are dangerous and liars my son. They are not really here. Rather they are narremes, fragments of story from somewhere else, the fabula, expanding and colonizing our reality with their narrative. They must be overcome. If we are to make a perfect society there is no place for any outside influence, outside contamination, from the likes of the devils, angels, aswang, anyone. You must be strong against the universe, lest I suffer sonatorrek.
value.attribution: Letter to a Constabulary Squire, from their father

value.text: The etheric sea is vast, yes, but you can only perceive it through your own person. The etheric sea is powerful, yes, but you can only influence it through your own mind. You are the center of everything that happens to you.
value.attribution: Annihilationist, a Memoir, available in all DiemCo trading partner polities

value.text: Let no knight lay with any other knight, nor show him any special affection. Any bond other than the bond of brothers, kindred, united in struggle and righteous war, will corrupt, and inevitably be abused. Want is a dangerous thing. And to want this affection a dangerous affliction.
value.attribution: Constabulary Knightâ€™s Creed, Section Eleven, Line Five

value.text:
Rorsh-wise Isacar-la, weeping, wending, summer colours fallen, seaward stretches, planetary oceans.
Terre-children, devil-children, all unfolding fabula, like cells interlinked.
value.attribution: From â€œSong for New Spaces,â€ a terre poem written shortly after arrival in the reach

value.text: Some have asked me, even some of the Elect, if I believe that humanity can ever be gentle, one with each other, if their spontaneous self-organization, in the Anarchy that is their space, can ever come to anything. Of this I have no answer other than to say, I have hope for them. This is my hope and my answer alike.
value.attribution: From a Harrisi humanology textbook

value.text: Tell-la people I na ken why left Gasuklay-la to become a sailor in the all black everything. Thatâ€™s part a lie. Itâ€™s impossible to leave home & na at least cogitate some theories as to the whywise. My coronation was loving. Kind despite the violence lifewise on that dusty frontier. Would na have wanted for anything-la. But life was set. Left â€˜cause was tired of other people dictating life-la. Any attempt to restrict the free will of another makes want-la chewing metal. I would rather die than submit and I expect other Freetravelers feel likewise.
value.attribution: Private Journal of a bawalangasi Freetraveler

value.text: This story canâ€™t have a happy ending, you know. A predator pilot and his z-machine together? It will never work. Everyone will die. We can only hope that someone, in a later time, will remember us. Maybe make some profit too.
value.attribution: Capitalism, a Romance, available in all DiemCo trading partner polities

value.text: Per our last missive, the polity identifying itself as a part of the Anarchy and calling itself DiemCo is currently reacting in accord with the belief that a way to the mythic terre homeworld may have been found. Additionally, the polity identifying itself as the Constabulary has begun reacting in accord with these beliefs as well in the time since our last missive. A predator and a Constabulary battle unit are expected to engage in combat. Threat assessment has been remodeled.
value.attribution: Psmanthic cryptex meme-carrier, as revealed during Constabulary torture

value.text: But above all else, son, remember this. There is no love outside of duty. Those blind in their debauchery within the Anarchy may think they have love, Freetravelers may think they have love, aliens may think they have love, but it is only when subjugated to the Constabulary, to the glory that has been humanity during our golden past, that love is found.
value.attribution: Letter to a Constabulary Squire, from their father

value.text:
Wonder yes, see yes, understand yes,
Yet none of these are worth sand unless you have a friend to share them with.
value.attribution: The Friend-In-Need Prayer, traditional Vomyodosoi text

value.text: Already Freetravelers are talking about me. About-la? About the woman who walked out of the point, stole a predator, stood up to the Constabulary. I am na sure that I like it, the barques signaling that they admire me. Iâ€™d like to disappear for awhile, but I na think Iâ€™ll get the opportunity to do that. I na ken what happens now, but cogitate-la the next few periods & perhaps thatâ€™s enough. After that? Weâ€™ll see where the currents of the etheric sea take me. Godspit, that is so pretentious.
value.attribution: Private Journal of a harrisi Freetraveler

value.name: The Company Port

flavorText.text: Welcome to Transcend Calypso. Please select psychogogic advert program now
flavorText.attribution: Planetary Winnipeg slogan, prior to the Constabulary ousting SaintsCo

value.description: Itâ€™s the top of a space elevator, a station in the void, perhaps even (shockingly) on a planet itself. But wherever it is physically the construction is all the same. The brands the same. The shops the same. The floor utilitarian. The walls to clean. The people too quiet. The cops everywhere. Remember to pay your docking fee.

questions.question: Two things you look for and canâ€™t find here

contracts.description: A company offering very subpar pay for hauling waste
A company offering subpar pay for transporting indentured workers
A company offering good pay for transporting an unmarked single crate so long as you donâ€™t ask any questions
A union fighting the corporations offering good pay to get a witness out of the port
A shady man who refuses to give a name offering good pay to get several suspicious bales out of the port
A lone family trying to sell themselves into indenturement at a different port offering subpar pay for transport
A company executive offering average pay to â€œexperience Freetraveler lifeâ€ with you
An indentured person offering very subpar pay to be smuggled out
A rival company offering excellent pay to smuggle out highly dangerous information on the company that owns the port
GENERATE_REPLACEMENT

value.name: The Free Port

flavorText.text: Pay the Shrouds well, keep your head down, donâ€™t drink vacuum

value.description: Some might consider it a smuggler hideout. To others an anti-corporate, post revolution haven. Or maybe itâ€™s wherever was convenient. But, spinning around some frontier world, or mined into an asteroid, or simple a few dozen old ships lashed together, one thing will always be true. No taxes. Perfect for Freetravelers.

options.text: A powerful, ancient z-machine left behind by the builders
Some might call it a gang
One rich family don, no one asks where they get their money

questions.question: Who is keeping the lights on and the air breathable here

contracts.description: A company offering average pay for intel on the Free Port
A company offering excellent pay to sabotage the Free Port
A concerned citizen offering subpar pay for something the Free Port desperately needs
A fellow Freetraveler offering average pay to be taken to a different Free Port where a ship waits
A former Freetraveler offering excellent pay for one last trip to the place they plan on retiring
A smuggler offering subpar pay for delivering something lifesaving through a controlled port or region
A smuggler offering good pay for delivering something addictive through a controlled port or region
A smuggler offering excellent pay for delivering something lethal through a controlled port or region
GENERATE_REPLACEMENT

value.name: The Pirate Port

flavorText.text: Ten times more murders in the past period than I in the kiloperiod prior
flavorText.attribution: Station AI on Harfast, after Irons gang take over

value.description: The air smells wrong when the doors open. The lights flicker. No one has repaired the docking clamps. This place is the real Libertalia, and like all pirate havens across all history it wonâ€™t last. It doesnâ€™t have to. It just needs to hold together for some dishonest wealth to be spent, unloaded, and traded back into the economy.

questions.question: What was this place before the world moved on

options.text: Food and medicine meant for elsewhere

questions.question: Two goods that pass through here

contracts.description: A company rep buying from pirates offering subpar pay for transporting what theyâ€™ve bought back to corporate space
Someone from whatever this place was before offering very subpar pay to take them off it
A company spy offering excellent pay to destroy the port
A fence offering excellent pay for delivery of whatever the port trades in, no matter the source
A pirate looking for someone willing to lure ships in towards an ambush offering average pay
A pirate looking for a partner on a heist on a different port offering good pay
A pirate looking for a partner on an attack on a ship offering excellent pay

value.name: The Military Port

flavorText.text: Synarchs. By definition we donâ€™t have to tell you what weâ€™re doing
flavorText.attribution: Transmission intercepted by DiemCo listening station 9

value.description: This is a port, yes, with docks and repairs and all the other expected things. But itâ€™s quiet. Buttoned up. Not for you. Because this is here to repair and resupply a military fleet, to hold systems and worlds. You are not military, Freetraveler. Do your business and move on quickly.

options.text: This place is actively under fire
This place is supplying the front
This place has not seen action in decaperiods
This place is occupying captured territory

questions.question: Something about this place

options.text: An isolated force claimed to defend a species

questions.question: What military holds this port

contracts.description: The military offering very subpar pay to leave and not tell anyone about what they saw
The military offering average pay for useful intel on the enemy
The military offering excellent pay to deliver weapons and supplies to the front lines
A war profiteer offering subpar pay to smuggle stolen military equipment away from the port
A war profiteer offering excellent pay to have some unique weapon smuggled away
A deserter offering very subpar pay to me freed from military service

value.name: The Authoritarian Port

flavorText.text: Terre, Freetravelers, syndicalists, synarchs, and all other disruptive elements are to be reported immediately

value.description: Safe behind military lines and military ports comes a place far away from military ports. Clean. Quiet. Orderly. You are not welcome here far from corporate degeneracy. Dissident elements and division have no place within the rules that have been imposed here. Freetraveler, anarchist, syndicalist, scofflaw. Move on.

questions.question: Whose fascist rule holds here
Two ways this port is policed and controlled

contracts.description: Dissidents offering very subpar pay for info
Dissidents offering subpar pay for weapons smuggled through
The police offering subpar pay for intel on dissidents
The police offering normal pay for delivery of a dissident leader
The police offering good pay for help putting down revolution
A dictator offering excellent pay for an offworld delicacy unable to be produced within the dictatorship

value.name: The Pharos

flavorText.text: The authorities say that my light is dangerous. All are wrong. Stare into me. Come closer. I love you

value.description: A lonely warning with a sacred meaning. Danger, the signal it sends says. Stay away. Or, alternately, this is how you safely transit. This is how you sail this straight, enter this port, keep flying. For most that is all this place is, a little reminder in the dark. Now you have arrived, after careful approach, to do business.

options.text: The way through the dark, a way home
Actual planetary ocean hazards and storms

questions.question: What this signal portends

options.text: A light pulsing through the dark
A view from a great height
A splash of waves, a taste of salt
A light, the sun, the sun, the sun

questions.question: Three things this lighthouse has

contracts.description: A stranded voyager very subpar pay for a way home
The lighthouse keeper offering very subpar pay for a simple comfort
The lighthouse offering subpar pay for something vital
The builder, the pharotekton, offering good pay to contain the light
The light offering good pay to behold

value.name: The Research Base

flavorText.text: The Choir clearly has found something out in Deep Wild Dark. Stolen from the Synarchs. An entity or object referred to in the Sinner Sun

value.description: Labs. Hothouses. Black ops exotemporal psych projects. The universe is full of places like this for the same reason it is full of the unexplained and the unknown. Magic, conventional, spatial, universal, what have you, where there is something unknown there will be people, power, and money interested in making it known.

questions.question: What is this place studying
Who is running this place

contracts.description: A lab project offering very subpar pay to be smuggled out
A harried scientist offering very subpar pay to get data out
A panicking scientist offering subpar pay to get a warning out
A bored scientist offering average pay to deliver an expected sample shipment
A twitchy scientist offering average pay to deliver unmarked packages
Leadership offering good pay to get a sample or project back
Something gone very wrong offering excellent pay to be let out

value.name: The Dark Matter Well

flavorText.text: I arrived yesterday, which was a bit of a problem since I was just pulling in now. When is this? I need to haul the dark matter out of here and get paid

value.description: Most people donâ€™t like to recognize how much of modern tech relies on the extraction of dark matter from the etheric sea. But someone has to do it, right? Punch a hole in the skin of the universe into a rich tract. Haul the black gold out. Try to ignore the damage and aura of spookiness for lightperiods all around it.

options.text: DiemCo, ApotheosInc, TianCo, or another company

questions.question: Who operates this place polluting the etheric sea

options.text: Tech doesnâ€™t work, or works oddly
Anyone staying too long gets sick
Thereâ€™s a song with no source

questions.question: Two things inescapably wrong and damaged about this place

contracts.description: Someone who owns the mine whose regular shipper unexpectedly quit and needs dark matter hauled, offering very subpar pay
A traumatized, terrified worker offering very subpar pay to be immediately taken off the well
A haunted, distracted worker offering subpar pay to bring them illegal drugs that might make working on the well a little more tolerable
An extradimensional entity speaking in whispers, asking for a piece of it to be taken elsewhere, offering excellent pay

value.name: Asteroid Mine

A great change of corporate, feudal, or tyrannical authority, making way to a commune where in theory all peopleâ€™s needs are provided for, from each according to their ability. That was then. All sorts of reasons to settle new places. Opportunity. Freedom. Resources. Curiosity.Imperialism. The best and worst of all aliens. This is just one of the newest.

But not all aliens exist within these interconnected networks. Some are pre-FTL. Pre-spaceflight. Even pre-industrial. This is one such world. Until very recently at least.

Or maybe it was just floating in the black for eons, unnoticed. Thatâ€™s plausible, right? Space is big. Try not to think about who might have built it or what might have climbed aboard.

Something truly unique and powerful, visible from megalightperiods away and well known and avoided for the very same reason. Why did you choose to come here of all places?

value.description: Freetravelers are a diaspora, rarely meeting together. But no one can stay like that always and occasionally, following odd, inconsistent protocols, you Freetravelers meet. Dozens of ships if not hundreds docking together in the big nothing. A change of favors, supplies, and crews. Many, many crews may begin their story here, having just changed ships and entered into an accord with each other.
